channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: A massive winter storm will hit large parts of the U.S. through the weekend
item.description: A large storm system is expected to hit this weekend, with snow and ice from Texas to the Carolinas and up the Eastern seaboard. The winter system could bring more than a foot of snow.
item.content:encoded:
A large storm system is expected to hit this weekend, with snow and ice from Texas to the Carolinas and up the Eastern seaboard. The winter system could bring more than a foot of snow.

(Image credit: National Weather Service)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: This local brass band is part of the soundtrack of resistance in Minneapolis
item.description: Brass Solidarity is a Minneapolis community band that was formed after George Floyd was killed. Now, they're playing at protests against ICE, in an effort to bring joy and break potential tension.
item.content:encoded: Brass Solidarity is a Minneapolis community band that was formed after George Floyd was killed. Now, they're playing at protests against ICE, in an effort to bring joy and break potential tension.
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: San Francisco is set to lose a historic fountain, beloved by its skate community
item.description: San Francisco is planning a renovation of a plaza that would destroy one of its most distinguishable features: a fountain that was an iconic backdrop to the city's skate scene in the '80s and '90s.
item.content:encoded: San Francisco is planning a renovation of a plaza that would destroy one of its most distinguishable features: a fountain that was an iconic backdrop to the city's skate scene in the '80s and '90s.
item.dc:creator: Katie DeBenedetti

item.title: Lindsey Halligan, Trump's former personal attorney, exits federal prosecutor post
item.description: The move comes after a federal judge wrote in a court document that the "charade of Ms. Halligan masquerading as the United States Attorney … must come to an end."
item.content:encoded:
The move comes after a federal judge wrote in a court document that the "charade of Ms. Halligan masquerading as the United States Attorney … must come to an end."

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Are ICE agents in Minneapolis breaking the law?
item.description: As protestors clash with some 3,000 federal immigration agents in the Twin Cities, we look at the legal issues with law professor Emmanuel Mauleón and Brennan Center for Justice's Elizabeth Goitein.
item.content:encoded: As protestors clash with some 3,000 federal immigration agents in the Twin Cities, we look at the legal issues with law professor Emmanuel Mauleón and Brennan Center for Justice's Elizabeth Goitein.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Supreme Court doubtful of Trump claim he can fire Fed governors by fiat
item.description: The Trump administration wants the authority to fire Lisa Cook, a Federal Reserve governor. Experts say that would undermine the independence of the central bank.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration wants the authority to fire Lisa Cook, a Federal Reserve governor. Experts say that would undermine the independence of the central bank.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: What to expect from Trump's Davos speech. And, the DOJ subpoenas Minnesota officials
item.description: President Trump is expected to address affordability at the World Economic Forum today. And, Minnesota officials react after the Justice Department subpoenas them.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is expected to address affordability at the World Economic Forum today. And, Minnesota officials react after the Justice Department subpoenas them.

(Image credit: Ludovic Marin)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: It's showdown time for the Fed's independence at the Supreme Court
item.description: At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.
item.content:encoded:
At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Trump administration claims offshore wind poses a threat. But it won't say how.
item.description: The Interior Department said pausing construction of offshore wind farms would allow the government agencies to work with project developers to mitigate potential risks. But wind companies say the administration isn't sharing information about newly-discovered threats.
item.content:encoded:
The Interior Department said pausing construction of offshore wind farms would allow the government agencies to work with project developers to mitigate potential risks. But wind companies say the administration isn't sharing information about newly-discovered threats.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer/AP)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: How ICE grew to be the highest-funded U.S. law enforcement agency
item.description: ICE's budget hovered around $10 billion for years. But President Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress are taking the agency's funding to unprecedented levels.
item.content:encoded:
ICE's budget hovered around $10 billion for years. But President Trump and the Republican-controlled Congress are taking the agency's funding to unprecedented levels.

(Image credit: Erin Hooley)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
